treasury_media.title: Reaching scale for coastal resilience: Aquaculture Supporting Mangrove Rehabilitation
treasury_media.description: A presentation of Field School programmes in Indonesia of the Building with Nature Project. Linked to the GCP-3 project 'Sustainable aquaculture to support mangrove forest restoration in Indonesia (PASMI)'. Presented by Roel Bosma (Wageningen...

projects.title: Sustainable aquaculture to support mangrove forest restoration in Indonesia (PASMI).
projects.description:
The research focuses on developing multi-trophic coastal aquaculture systems, which can support the restoration of (1) the farmer's livelihoods and (2) the mangrove forests in Indonesia. In these systems, different organisms, such as shrimp, blue crab and others, will be produced in an integrated way, thereby supporting resilient livelihoods while also safeguarding the mangrove functions for coastal protection. The research supports mangrove restoration projects in three  regencies/villages along the north coast of Java: Demak, Brebes (Kaliwlingi village) and Sawah Luhur village, bordering Banten Bay and Pulau Dua Nature Reserve. 
Parters: 
- Wetlands International Indonesia, 
- Diponegoro University’s Faculty of Fisheries and Marine Science (Semarang). 
- Ecoshape (Deltares, Imares, BosKalis, Witteveen & Bos, IHE).

profile_positions.title: Sustainable Agriculture Production System Expert
project manager and researcher sustainable production systems
Research project manager

profile_positions.description:
Together with local partners, I developed training and credit programs for:
•	cattle milk production. Six mixed male and female self-help groups, prepared their farms for upgrading cattle with artificial insemination. 
•	milk processing. Nine farmers` wives received credit for the first equipment and two for the construction of a milk processing unit.
•	construction of housing for pigs, sheep and goats, rabbits and cattle, principally built in local materials.
I planned and carried out the participatory action-research on animal husbandry to support and innovate the government extension program on sheep reproduction management and pig fattening by women.
On the job, I instructed participatory methods of training and research, and edited manuals for extension workers and artificial insemination.
The INERA and the Dutch Embassy invited my regularly to participate in workshops on research evaluation and planning.
profile_positions.title: Animal Scientist at PDISaB in Koudougou, Burkina Faso
Animal scientist in the Farming Systems research team
Lecturer at the department of Animal Science, University of Ouagadougou

profile_positions.description:
At the Toma-project I supervised the demonstration and research activities at the Livestock Centre, and prepared and participated in the extension and training program on animal traction and livestock production, between 1982 and 1985. The training program for village animal health care groups evolved into a regional program; I was involved the development of the manuals. Each year, I supervised the research work of one or two students from the University of Ouagadougou.
Before joining Toma I was the project director’s assistant in the Markoye EC project in charge of the organisation and training of farmers, and conducted research on fodder crops.
profile_positions.title: élevage et socio-économie
